patterns: Valid Proof of Identity for Graduation Documents
Assigning a Representative for Documents Pick-up
responses: Students who received an email to pick-up their graduation documents or transcript must come to the campus on the schedule provided on the email and bring their original valid proof of identity (i.e. student ID, passport, license). If you would like to assign a representative to pick-up your transcript or graduation documents, you must send an email to registration@tbcollege.com. You must follow the instructions provided to you on the email and DO NOT send your authorized representative without completing the process yet to avoid the any inconvenience. The authorized representative must follow the instructions provided to you.

patterns: Procedure for Study Permit Extension Letter
Information Required for Study Permit Extension Letter
Timeframe for Study Permit Extension Letter
how can i extend my study permit
Can you guide me through the procedure to extend my study permit?
What documentation is required to renew my study permit?
How long does it take to process a study permit extension?
responses:
Please send an email request using your college email account to registration@tbcollege.com

You must include on your email your name, student ID number, program, and the copy of your study permit.
We will provide you your study permit extension letter within 2 to 3 business days upon receive of the request.

I want to make changes to my profile, what should I do?
responses: Students must ensure that they have updated contact information (phone number, address), and immigration document on the Services Portal. Link to the Services Portal: [Services Portal](https://services.tbcollege.com)

patterns: Status of Completion Letters for graduates
responses: You will receive an email from the Registration Department regarding your completion letter. For any further questions or concerns, please send an email to registration@tbcollege.com with your name, student ID number, and program or you can fill up this form [Link for the form](https://loyalistcollege.com/current-students/student-forms/)

responses: Students can download Enrollment verification documents through their myLoyalist portal.

patterns: Updating Mailing Address for Final Semester
responses: If you are on your final semester and you have excess money on your student’s account, you must update your mailing address so you can receive it back. The process would take at least 3 to 6 weeks. You may reach lcitaccounts@loyalistcollege.com if you have any inquiries. [Link](https://loyalistcollege.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/Mailing-Address-Instructions.pdf)

patterns: Can you explain what co-op is?
What exactly is a co-op program?
Can you tell me more about co-op opportunities?
Can you provide more information about the co-op program?
responses: Co-op stands for cooperative education, which is a fantastic opportunity for students like you to combine classroom learning with real-world work experience. It's a chance to dive into your field of study, gain hands-on skills, and make connections in the industry. To know more about how co-op works at our college, contact us at careerservices@tbcollege.com

patterns: Are there any programs with co-op?
responses:
The following programs require co-op:
- Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
- Cloud Computing
- Cyber Security
- Hospitality Management – Canadian Hotels and Resorts
- Supply Change Management
- Enterprise Resource Planning
- Wireless Information Networking
- Computer Software and Database Development
- Global Project Management
- Quality Engineering Management
If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at careerservices@tbcollege.com

patterns: When do I need to complete co-op?
When do I need to complete co-op?
responses:
Co-op will take place in Semester Four for the programs listed above.
If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at [Email](careerservices@tbcollege.com)

patterns: What is the length of co-op?
responses:
The co-op work term is generally 14 weeks. Students are required to complete a minimum of 420 work hours. Co-op starts the first day of classes in the last semester (semester 4).
If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at careerservices@tbcollege.com

patterns: Where can I find co-op jobs?
Where can I find co-op jobs?
Where to search for coop jobs?
Where can I locate coop job openings?
Where to find cooperative education job postings?
responses:
Students are encouraged to apply for positions on the Devant Job Board which can be accessed on Moodle.

This board has postings for part-time, full-time, and co-op positions.
Devant can be accessed with this link.
[Devant Link!](https://devant.careercentre.me/welcome/Devant-Group)

patterns: Are co-op jobs paid or unpaid?
Are co-op jobs paid or unpaid?
Are co-op roles paid or not?
Do co-op jobs come with compensation?
Are co-op positions compensated with salaries?
responses:
Co-op jobs must be paid.

If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at careerservices@
tbcollege.com

patterns: where to find the pre-approved co-op list
responses:
For students who are unsure if a particular co-op position matches their program, you are encouraged to send the job description for pre-approval. Send the job description from the job posting to careerservices
@tbcollege.com, specifying this is for pre-approval. The academics department will review the job posting and will let you know if it is pre-approved.
Note:
- Your pre-approved job description will be on hold with a validity of 1 month
- If you wish to complete your co-op with the pre-approval submission, you need to inform the college before the validity expires along with submitting your Co-op offer letter that meets the Co-op checklist requirements.
- If you do not provide an update to Career Services within 1 month of receiving pre-approval, it will be revoked.
If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at careerservices@tbcollege.com

patterns: Where can I go for questions regarding AIP?
responses:
You can find all the information about AIP on the link below or you can reach out to us at careerservices@
tbcollege.com
[Applied Industry Project: Innovation Hub | Rise 360](https://articulate.com/)

patterns: What services does the Career Center offer?
responses:
The Career Center offers various services to help students with their career development, including:
- Resume and cover letter assistance
- Job search strategies
- Interview preparation
- Career counseling and exploration
- Workshops and events
- Access to job postings and co-op/placement opportunities.
If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at careerservices@tbcollege.com

patterns: What should I do if I missed the assignment?
What should I do if I missed the assessment?
What's the procedure for missing the assessment?
What's the procedure for missing the assignment?
I was unable to submit my assessment
I was unable to submit my assignment
I couldn't complete the assessment on time
responses:
If you missed the assessment, please contact your instructor as soon as possible to discuss your situation. They will provide guidance on how to proceed.
You can also fill out the missed assessment form within five business days of the assessment date.
[Click here to fill out the form](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=PlKz1i9IoEKTulrUSLtK5CmSQlqeXtROpTBCYMDn29lUMFdTR0VaTFJIV1BBTVAzN0dCQTdQODdDVyQlQCN0PWcu)

patterns: How do I use Microsoft Outlook 365?
responses: To use Microsoft Outlook 365 effectively, you can refer to the instructions provided in this PDF document: [Outlook 365 User Guide](https://tbcollege0.sharepoint.com/:b:/s/ExternShare/EROfVbHhIPtBhEkm3tUPCfsB_jtAsRfSRBW92X-GCzeyAQ?e=9Jl8u4). It covers essential features and functions to help you get started.

patterns: How do I report lost items?
responses: If you have lost any items, please contact the security desk at the entrance of the college. They will assist you in reporting and retrieving lost belongings.

patterns: Can you tell me about upcoming events?
Is there any event coming up?
Where can I find information about events?
I want to know about events
responses: You can find information about upcoming events on our Moodle platform. Check out the Events section here: [Events](https://moodle.tbcollege.com/moodle/mod/folder/view.php?id=299455)

patterns: Can you provide information about guard.me?
I want to know about guard me
What is the link for guard me?
responses: You can find detailed information about guard.me, our international insurance provider, on their official website. For more information Visit [Loyalist College | guard.me](https://www.guard.me/loyalistcollege)

patterns: There is an error in my Letter of Acceptance (LOA), what should I do?
How can I fix the error in my LOA?
I found a mistake in my LOA, what can be done?
LOA has an error, how to correct it?
Issue with my Letter of Acceptance (LOA)
responses: If you've found an error in your Letter of Acceptance (LOA), please contact the international admissions team at [internationaladmissions@loyalistcollege.com](mailto:internationaladmissions@loyalistcollege.com) for assistance.

patterns: How do I get a copy of my transcript?
Where can I find my transcript?
Getting a copy of my transcript
responses: To get a copy of your transcript, sign in to [myLoyalist](#) and click on the Banner icon. Once you're in Banner, navigate to 'Student Services' -> 'Student Records' -> 'Request Printed/Official Transcript.' Please remember not to select Loyalist College for the External College Code.

patterns: Does LCIT offer a shuttle bus service?
Is there a shuttle bus from LCIT?
How can I get to LCIT?
Is there a shuttle bus from college?
does college have a bus service
responses: Yes, if you have an on-campus class schedule at LCIT, you can purchase an LCIT Shuttle Bus Pass. The College will post the details about the bus pass on Moodle.

patterns: How do I get my LCIT ID card?
Where can I pick up my LCIT ID?
How to get LCIT student card?
Where do I get my LCIT card?
How to get student ID at LCIT?
how can i get my ID card
where to pick my id card
responses: Loyalist College in Toronto students must come to campus to pick up their Student ID cards. Students will need to bring their passport and Letter of Acceptance (LOA). Please visit reception from Monday to Friday, between 10 am and 2 pm, to have your photo taken and obtain your card.

patterns: How do I get my health insurance card?
Where can I find my health insurance details?
How to get my health insurance information?
Where will I get my insurance card?
How to receive health insurance details?
responses: Once registered, we will send you your health insurance information to your college email address after day 10 of the start of the semester. Please contact studentsuccess@tbcollege.com if you do not receive your policy number and any additional information about health insurance.

patterns: How do I access the campus Library?
What is the process to enter the Library?
How can I get into the campus Library?
Steps to access the TBC/LCIT Library?
responses:
To access the TBC/LCIT Library, please visit https://tbcollege.librarika.com/
Current students simply present their student identification cards at the reception desk when borrowing books.

patterns: How to get the Official Break Letter?
How can I request a break letter?
Where can I find the break letter?
responses: Loyalist College does not provide letters for employment purposes confirming summer breaks. Instead, employers are requested to view the Academic Schedule, which outlines dates for scheduled programs. International Students are also encouraged to provide employers with a copy of their Letter of Acceptance (LOA) indicating the start/end dates of the academic program and their Study Permit, which outlines the conditions of their employment. Employers can also refer to this page on the Government of Canada’s website to review the eligibility requirements for working in Canada.

patterns: Where can I find my transcript?
How do I request a copy of my transcript?
Get a copy of my grades
How can I access my academic records?
responses: Sign in to myLoyalist and click the Banner icon. Once in Banner, click ‘Student Services – ‘Student Records’ – ‘Request Printed/Official Transcript.’ Note: Please do not select Loyalist College for the External College Code.

Study permit, co-op permit, and PGWP application

responses: Please contact the immigration consultant using your college email. You can check the availability and contact information of our immigration consultation on Moodle – Student Life – Professional Consultation.

responses: You can check the availability and contact information of our consultant psychotherapist on Moodle – Student Life – Professional Consultation.

patterns: How to enroll to retake a course?
How can I retake a course?
How to enroll in a retake?
responses: Please follow the directions on the Moodle dashboard to add a course you wish to retake.

patterns: What is the passing grade for a course?
Minimum grade to pass a course
How much do I need to pass a course?
responses: All courses will have a minimum passing grade of 50%.

patterns: What GPA do I need to graduate?
How much GPA is needed for graduation?
responses: A minimum of 60% GPA is required for graduation from all certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, and graduate diploma programs.

patterns: I had a connectivity error during my quiz.
What to do if I face connectivity error during a quiz?
Quiz issue due to connection problem
responses: Be sure to document your error and error time. Send an email to your instructor to show your evidence for missing the assessment. If declined, fill out the following request form for accommodation within five business days of the assessment date. It will be assessed by the College.
